intro: Erysimum californicum, commonly known as the California wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in coastal and inland habitats, including grasslands and chaparral. The plant features basal rosettes of linear, gray-green leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers in the spring. Its flowers are typically 5-lobed and have a distinctive, slightly hairy appearance. Erysimum californicum is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in disturbed soils.
